edu.ucla.sspace.text

Class PatPho

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.text.PatPho

  • public class PatPho
extends Object
    An implementation of the PatPho phonological representation system. This implementation is based on the following paper.
    • Li, Ping and MacWhinney, Brian. 2001. Proceedings of Behavior Research Methods, Instruments, \& Computers. 2002, Volme 34, Issue 3, 408-415.

    This encoder is intended to transform phonemes into vectors for use in neural networks. This encoder will transform a phoneme into a vector of three real values. Given a list of phonemes, it will transform them into a syllbalic templated set of real values. Up to six phonemes may be passed to this encoder. This encoder is dependent on the IPA phonological representation scheme.
    Author:
    Keith Stevens

    • Constructor Detail

      • PatPho

        public PatPho()
        Creates a new PatPho instance with a six syllablic template.

      • PatPho

        public PatPho(boolean useSixSyllables)
        Creates a new PatPho instance. If useSixSyllables is true, a six syllablic template will be used, otherwise a three syllbalic template will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • vectorize

        public double[] vectorize(String phoneme)
        Returns a copy of the double representation of the given phoneme.
        Parameters:
        phoneme - A string representation of a phoneme using the IPA format
        Returns:
        The three double values representing the given phoneme
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the requested phoneme does not have a mapping

      • vectorize

        public double[] vectorize(List<String> phonemes)
        Returns a left-justified syllablilic template representation of the given list of phonemes. Every three values correspond to a single phoneme representation. If six syllables are used, a vector of 99 values is returned, otherwise a vector of 54 values is returned.
        Parameters:
        phonemes - A list of string phoneme representation using the IPA format
        Returns:
        A vector representing the word
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If any requested phoneme does not have a mapping
